p: The aerial parts of Eryngium caeruleum were collected from various areas of the Malakand division and authenticated by Dr. Nasrullah at Department of Botany, University of Malakand. The plant was pressed and kept in the herbarium of University of Malakand, Pakistan under voucher specimen number H.UOM.BG.109. After collection, the plant was cut into small pieces and allowed to dry in shade. After drying, the plant was powdered using a cutter mill and macerated in 80% methanol for two weeks. After soaking, the plant sample was filtered using Whatman filter paper. The filtrates were evaporated under reduced pressure using rotary evaporator at 40Â°C (Farooq et al., 2019; Sadiq et al., 2019). Semi solid masse of methanolic extract of E. caerulum was obtained weighing ~400 g.
